head.supplied: National Herbarium ¶ Melbourne, 6th September 1897 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you that the Trustees of the late Baron Von Mueller have now delivered the Books purchased by the Government fo...

div.p: From Georg Luehmann to Charles Topp
E97/9154, unit 958, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to inform you that the Trustees of the late Baron Von Mueller have now delivered the Books purchased by the Government for the library of the Govt Botanist's Branch, with the exception of some that could not yet be found and some others, principally periodicals, which the Revd W. Potter desires to keep on loan in order to look through them for any notices having reference to Baron Von Mueller. Perhaps it would be advisable to ask to Mr. Potter to state a definite term for which he wishes to retain these works, say three months. As that gentleman also has the list of the works purchased since 1873, extracted from my Account books, I should like to have copy of same.
MS annotations: 'Retd from Mr Luehmann 16/[9]'. '2 dozen wood blocks & £12 owing to the Govt Printer'. 'May be p.a. 10.9.97'.
